channel.title: Buzzing on The Wall Street Journal
channel.description: 用中文浏览华尔街日报热门报道

item.title: Here is an early look at the front page of The Wall Street Journal's weekend edition https://t.co/6fmcJBYSom https://t.co/WPg3LkCnQl

Elon Musk handed the first few Tesla Model Y vehicles to customers at the opening of Giga Berlin-Brandenburg, the electric-car company’s first European factory #WSJWhatsNow https://t.co/vv5sl4yk59 https://t.co/c8XTVzGUrS
Women in Afghanistan must now be accompanied by a male relative to complete many basic tasks and say the Taliban are squeezing them out of public life https://t.co/MKPlcfKpjr
Russia said it was refocusing its mission in Ukraine on the country’s east, indicating a shift from its initial attempt to capture Kyiv https://t.co/3uOemnJiE2

Utah has become the 12th state to enact some sort of ban on transgender children in school sports after lawmakers voted to override Gov. Spencer Cox’s veto of legislation banning transgender youth athletes from playing on girls teams https://t.co/fcqd6Nyg4W

From @WSJopinion: It is vital to Europe’s peace and security that Ukraine not lose what remains of its Black Sea coastline, writes @ArthurLHerman. The U.S. and NATO can protect this strategic flank of Europe. https://t.co/Cde2rPHyec
The unlikeliest group of players ever to step onto the court at the Sweet 16 came out for warmups wearing T-shirts that declared the ethos that defines them: MORE IS POSSIBLE. https://t.co/QJrTJRgqwA

The House panel probing the Jan. 6, 2021, attack on the Capitol has texts between Justice Clarence Thomas’s wife, conservative activist Virginia Thomas, and former President Donald Trump’s then-chief of staff, Mark Meadows, regarding the 2020 elections https://t.co/M6DNABsKPn
The U.S. is preparing sanctions targeting Russian companies it says are involved in buying goods and services for Moscow’s military and spy services https://t.co/dEvRinsYIk

Black News Channel, a cable news network that went on the air two years ago to provide an alternative look at news from Black Americans’ perspective, is shutting down, the outlet’s chief executive told employees on Friday https://t.co/SNXnRNonTC
Phoenix is America’s No. 1 metro area for inflation during the Biden administration. Voters there are not happy. https://t.co/75lxJEBq1R
Vanessa Bryant, widow of the late basketball star Kobe Bryant, and Nike have reached an agreement to collaborate on new shoes and start a youth basketball center https://t.co/JRS2wHnusf
When President Biden visits Poland, he will arrive in a country that has been thrust to the forefront of Western efforts to repel Russian aggression https://t.co/pDIvDFyb69

A 14-year-old boy died after falling off a 430-foot-tall ride called the Orlando FreeFall in Florida’s Icon Park Thursday night, officials said. “This death investigation is in its very early stages.” https://t.co/r7Khf8BOCL
Biden made a campaign vow that the U.S. should only use nuclear weapons to deter a nuclear threat. Under pressure from allies, he’s backing off that pledge. https://t.co/QIsOvjkQEu

Republican senators indicated that they don’t plan to take steps to significantly delay or block the confirmation of Supreme Court nominee Ketanji Brown Jackson, who wrapped up her testimony a day earlier and is on track for a vote early next month https://t.co/Xl926cblVy
Beijing is wary that its alignment with Russia during the Ukraine crisis could also cost its relationship with Europe https://t.co/eyNNJwEIF3
Women in Afghanistan must now be accompanied by a male relative to complete many basic tasks and say the Taliban are squeezing them out of public life https://t.co/0CqDvDI8jW

Authorities in Mariupol said about 300 people died in a theater hundreds of civilians were using as a bomb shelter when a Russian airstrike hit on March 16. Ukrainian President Zelenksy said last week that about 130 people had emerged alive. https://t.co/8NBgA3ZLuw
President Biden is meeting with Poland's leader as more than 2 million Ukrainian refugees have crossed the border into the NATO country https://t.co/6amEAU9lSz

Russian Central Bank Gov. Elvira Nabiullina tried to resign after the invasion of Ukraine, people familiar with the matter said. Russian President Vladimir Putin instead nominated her for a third term. https://t.co/QvkD7seO4O
The U.K. government said that Russian mercenary company Wagner Group is being used to try to assassinate Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky https://t.co/Tm3eixS2vS
Italy will miss a second consecutive World Cup after losing a do-or-die playoff to North Macedonia, the team ranked 67th in the world https://t.co/5qpg8DHNPK

Goldman Sachs CEO David Solomon, who occasionally moonlights as an electronic dance musician, will perform at the Lollapalooza music festival in July, the festival announced on Tuesday https://t.co/cR8PiGyGeV

From @WSJopinion: Obama and I attended meetings with Putin in 2014 and 2015—and the conversations with Putin were worse than pointless. He blatantly lied to us about everything, writes @David_Cameron https://t.co/0yl36cgbxo
A federal jury has found Nebraska Rep. Jeff Fortenberry guilty of lying to federal investigators in a bid to conceal illegal campaign contributions https://t.co/JHPIoC8XVh

The U.K. government said that Russian mercenary company Wagner Group, which the EU calls a proxy force for Russia’s Defense Ministry, is being used by Russia to try to assassinate Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky https://t.co/yezBqy8nay
Former President Donald Trump alleged in a lawsuit that Hillary Clinton and more than two dozen other defendants conspired before the 2016 election to tarnish his image https://t.co/ueM6XrtI15

Russian Central Bank Gov. Elvira Nabiullina tried to resign after the invasion of Ukraine, people familiar with the matter said. Her effort was rejected by Russian President Vladimir Putin who instead nominated her for a third term. https://t.co/4pYtcfShKM
Steelmaker Severstal says Citigroup has frozen interest payments to investors in the company’s bonds, setting up a debt default https://t.co/3YI430HqGv
Uber will list all New York City taxis on its app, which could help the ride-hailing giant alleviate a driver shortage and temper high fares https://t.co/DhGjVfeBYl

California Gov. Gavin Newsom proposed a new plan to help ease the burden of higher gasoline prices on his state’s drivers, including giving car owners cash, temporarily providing free public transportation and reducing fuel taxes https://t.co/86x23IiNvi

President Biden said the U.S. will respond if Russia uses chemical weapons in Ukraine, following a meeting with NATO leaders to address new measures to help Ukraine in the monthlong war https://t.co/1Nl53Qzjlb

The U.N. passed a resolution criticizing Russia for its role in the rapidly deteriorating humanitarian situation in Ukraine. The nonbinding resolution demanded “an immediate cessation of the hostilities by the Russian Federation against Ukraine.” https://t.co/qiOKNz49N3

The U.K. government said that Russian mercenary company Wagner Group, which the EU calls a proxy force for Russia’s Defense Ministry, is being used by Russia to try to assassinate Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky https://t.co/hbgkidCqEH

The United States will welcome up to 100,000 refugees fleeing the fighting in Ukraine as the humanitarian crisis from Russia’s attack on its neighbor worsens, administration officials familiar with the plans said https://t.co/cv9EAB6Vxg
Western sanctions in response to Vladimir Putin’s war in Ukraine are starting to hit Russia’s vital oil-and-gas industry #WSJWhatsNow https://t.co/TrNvFAdSlB https://t.co/dHYfQ1djbE
A former Boeing pilot was found not guilty of deceiving regulators about a 737 MAX flight-control system blamed for two deadly crashes https://t.co/G8Va0T1LIx
Ukraine said it struck Russian-occupied port facilities in the Azov Sea city of Berdyansk, destroying a Russian ship as the war entered its second month https://t.co/aJqQYyaKz8

Billionaire philanthropist MacKenzie Scott gave to groups including Planned Parenthood, Habitat for Humanity and the Boys & Girls Clubs of America, aiming to support needs of underrepresented groups https://t.co/Ed7JkCgf0d
Take an early look at the front page of The Wall Street Journal https://t.co/5xQPDPcm8q https://t.co/tKOTiEoRH6

From @WSJopinion: Media and tech companies that colluded in concealing potentially critical information about Hunter Biden in 2020 will pay no price. This is what is so corrosive of trust and, in the end, of the system itself, writes @gerardtbaker. https://t.co/42SbrS5LDz

The U.S. hasn’t sanctioned Russian oligarch Roman Abramovich because Ukraine’s President Zelensky said he's acting as a go-between in peace talks with Russia, people familiar with the plans said https://t.co/ujwTHkbrFj

From @WSJopinion: Through the IMF, the U.S. gave Russia $17 billion while troops gathered on Ukraine’s border, writes @SenJohnKennedy. Let’s shut off the spigot to communists and terrorists and make sure it stays shut https://t.co/UL54sIMjPh

Up to 40,000 Russian troops have been killed, wounded, taken prisoner or are missing in Ukraine, said a senior military official from NATO. The alliance estimates that between 7,000 and 15,000 Russian soldiers have been killed since the invasion began. https://t.co/LVdzm2Nchy
An ex-Manhattan prosecutor who investigated Donald Trump said in a resignation letter last month that he believed the ex-president committed numerous felonies https://t.co/IWxea5Hh7A

In one of her last known conversations, former Secretary of State Madeleine Albright "spent the entire conversation talking about how Ukraine had to be defended," former President Bill Clinton said Wednesday https://t.co/34wSO4hFPV
President Volodymyr Zelensky called on people around the world to mark Thursday—one month since Russia invaded—by showing their support for Ukraine https://t.co/P9KCAOehyx

Russian forces have stopped trying to move toward Kyiv and instead have begun entrenching themselves in the city’s outskirts, a senior U.S. defense official told reporters Wednesday https://t.co/pOofzGNFhf
With gasoline above $4, consumer interest in electric vehicles is growing https://t.co/7yiuqiwSns
